alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Gallatin; Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN CARROLL, WEST CENTRAL GRANT, NORTHWESTERN OWEN AND WESTERN GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Vevay, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Vevay, Owenton, Kentucky Speedway, Ghent, Sanders, Sparta, Ethridge, Interstate 71 at Mile Marker 52, Long Ridge, Wheatley, New Liberty, Twin Bridges, Elmer Davis Lake, US Route 42 at State Route 184 and Carson. This includes I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 50 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
